title: Can a corporation "own" a color?
excerpt: A handful of companies have pushed the boundaries of intellectual property law by laying claim to individual colors.

title: Trademarking color is absurd. But not for the reasons you think - Fast Company
excerpt: Trying to crush other companies' use of color is not only petty; it completely misses the point of branding.

title: Likelihood of Confusion of Trademarks | Trademark
excerpt: When trademark infringement cases go to trial, the judge tries to determine the likelihood confusion taking place among consumers. Judges do not actually converse with consumers or take a poll among consumers, but they do use a set of criteria established by the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals in the AMF, Inc v Sleekcraft Boats [â€¦]
